reviews.text:
Great museum with unique idea

Some exhibitions were extremely interesting with sad stories and old items. There are unique connections with certain items, and various relationship with loved ones (or things).

It is nice to visit if you are in Zagreb, it is close to many of the other attractions, so make sure to give it a stop.

The museum is a bit tight, so it is recommended to come at a less crowded time.

A Unique and Thought-Provoking Experience

The Museum of Broken Relationships is a truly unique and thought-provoking experience. This museum creatively showcases stories of love and loss through a collection of personal artifacts donated by people from around the world. Each item has its own narrative, making it a fascinating journey through the highs and lows of relationships.

The exhibits are both poignant and humorous, offering visitors a chance to reflect on their own experiences while connecting with the universal themes of love and heartbreak. The layout is well-organized, allowing you to take your time and absorb each story.

This museum is a must-visit for anyone interested in the complexities of human relationships. It’s not only entertaining but also deeply moving, making it an unforgettable part of your visit to Zagreb.

We visited it out of curiosity. It's definitely a different kind of museum, probably not something you've seen before. It's a nice activity if you are in a romantic mood but not sure it's worth 7€. I would recommend a visit , only if you have free time in Zagreb. Don't prioritise it .

Stumbled across this museum and super happy I did. It’s made up of memorabilia from people that have experienced broken relationships, including small stories about what happened. Be prepared to get in your feelings there’s some pretty deep stories here. There’s also a coffee shop attached to the museum if you want a drink and small snack. I would definitely recommend checking it out when coming to Zagreb.

This was a weirdly emotional visit. The stories and artifacts were interesting - you can spend an hour here and cover everything. This is a very different type of museum, interestingly crowdsourced. Few stories were heartbreaking to read while few would lighten your mood up and encourage to come out of shitty relations. Go visit this one in Zagreb- it will take an hour but feel good and different.
